subject: Law
title: Environmental Justice
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Environmental Justice.

hook.text: A toxic waste dump opens next to a poor neighborhood. Wealthy areas never face this. That's environmental injustice.

buildup.text: Environmental justice demands fair treatment: no group should bear a disproportionate share of pollution's burden.

discovery.text: Executive Order 12898 (1994) directed agencies to address environmental justice for minority and low-income communities.

twist.text: Studies show communities of color are far more likely to live near polluting facilities. The pattern is consistent.

climax.text: The Justice40 initiative aims to direct 40% of climate investment benefits to disadvantaged communities.

punchline.text: Clean air shouldn't depend on your ZIP code. The law is slowly agreeing.

quiz.question: What does environmental justice demand?
options: No group bears disproportionate environmental burden
